alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:54AM PST until January 03 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...High astronomical tides coupled with strong southerly winds will cause minor flooding in low-lying areas along Humboldt Bay and the northern Humboldt coast. Minor flooding is also expected along the Del Norte County south of Crescent City on roads that are normally dry such as Anchor Way road. High tide is predicted to be around 8.73 feet at North Spit tidal gauge and 8.75 at Crescent City Harbor tidal gauge around 11 AM this morning. Minor flooding is possible whenever tide levels reach 8.8 feet or more. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte and Northern Humboldt Coast Counties. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 1 PM PST this afternoon.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast
